name: Aloe Vera
description: Succulent plant with thick gel-filled leaves, commonly grown as houseplant.
traditional_uses: Topical application for minor burns and skin irritation.
current_evidence_summary: Limited evidence for topical wound healing.
contraindications: Avoid internal use without medical supervision.
interactions: May affect absorption of some medications when used internally.
toxicity_notes: Internal use can cause digestive upset.

name: Angelica
description: Tall aromatic biennial herb with compound leaves.
traditional_uses: Traditional digestive aid and respiratory support.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Anise
description: Annual herb with aromatic seeds used as culinary spice.
traditional_uses: Digestive aid and flavoring.
interactions: May interact with hormone-sensitive medications.

name: Basil
description: Annual culinary herb with aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Bay Leaf
description: Evergreen tree with aromatic leaves used in cooking.
traditional_uses: Culinary spice and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with diabetes medications.

name: Calendula
description: Annual flower with bright orange or yellow petals.
traditional_uses: Topical application for skin conditions.
current_evidence_summary: Some evidence for wound healing properties.
contraindications: Avoid if allergic to plants in the daisy family.
interactions: May interact with sedative medications.

name: Chamomile
description: Annual herb with small daisy-like flowers.
traditional_uses: Calming tea and topical skin treatment.
current_evidence_summary: Some evidence for mild sedative effects.
contraindications: Avoid if allergic to plants in the daisy family.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning and sedative medications.

name: Chives
description: Perennial herb with mild onion-flavored leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb.
contraindications: Avoid large amounts if allergic to onions.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Coriander
description: Annual herb with aromatic leaves and seeds.
traditional_uses: Culinary spice and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Dandelion
description: Perennial herb with toothed leaves and yellow flowers.
traditional_uses: Traditional liver and kidney support.
contraindications: Avoid if allergic to plants in the daisy family.
interactions: May interact with diuretic and diabetes medications.

name: Dill
description: Annual herb with feathery leaves and aromatic seeds.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Echinacea
description: Perennial herb with purple cone-shaped flowers.
traditional_uses: Traditional immune system support.
contraindications: Avoid if allergic to plants in the daisy family.
interactions: May interact with immune-suppressing medications.

name: Eucalyptus
description: Evergreen tree with aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Traditional respiratory support.
contraindications: Avoid internal use without medical supervision.
interactions: May interact with diabetes medications.
toxicity_notes: Essential oil can be toxic if ingested.

name: Fennel
description: Perennial herb with feathery leaves and aromatic seeds.
traditional_uses: Culinary spice and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with hormone-sensitive medications.

name: Garlic
description: Perennial bulb vegetable with pungent cloves.
traditional_uses: Culinary ingredient and traditional cardiovascular support.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Ginger
description: Perennial herb with aromatic underground stem.
traditional_uses: Culinary spice and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Lavender
description: Perennial shrub with aromatic purple flowers.
traditional_uses: Aromatherapy and traditional calming agent.
current_evidence_summary: Some evidence for anxiety and sleep benefits.
interactions: May interact with sedative medications.
toxicity_notes: Generally safe for topical and aromatherapy use.

name: Lemon Balm
description: Perennial herb with lemon-scented leaves.
traditional_uses: Traditional calming agent.
interactions: May interact with sedative and thyroid medications.

name: Marjoram
description: Perennial herb with small aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional digestive aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Mint
description: Perennial herb with aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional digestive aid.
contraindications: Avoid large amounts if prone to heartburn.
interactions: May interact with acid-reducing medications.

name: Oregano
description: Perennial herb with small aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb with traditional antimicrobial uses.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Parsley
description: Biennial herb with flat or curly leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional diuretic.
interactions: May interact with diuretic medications.

name: Peppermint
description: Perennial herb with aromatic menthol-scented leaves.
traditional_uses: Traditional digestive aid.
contraindications: Avoid large amounts if prone to heartburn.
interactions: May interact with acid-reducing medications.

name: Rosemary
description: Evergreen shrub with needle-like aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional memory aid.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Sage
description: Perennial herb with gray-green aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional antiseptic.
current_evidence_summary: Limited evidence for cognitive and antimicrobial effects.
contraindications: Avoid large amounts during pregnancy and breastfeeding.
interactions: May interact with sedative and diabetes medications.

name: Thyme
description: Perennial herb with small aromatic leaves.
traditional_uses: Culinary herb and traditional antiseptic.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.

name: Valerian
description: Perennial herb with small white or pink flowers.
traditional_uses: Traditional sleep aid.
contraindications: Avoid during pregnancy and when driving.
interactions: May interact with sedative medications.

name: Yarrow
description: Perennial herb with feathery leaves and white flowers.
traditional_uses: Traditional wound treatment.
contraindications: Avoid during pregnancy and if allergic to plants in the daisy family.
interactions: May interact with blood thinning medications.
